headline: Should You Buy the Invesco QQQ ETF During the Nasdaq Correction? History Offers a Clear Answer.
summary: It's home to many of the trillion-dollar tech giants that lead the artificial intelligence (AI) industry, so it has delivered spectacular returns over the last couple of years.  The Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ) is an exchange-traded fund (ETF) that tracks the performance of the Nasdaq-100 by holding the same stocks and maintaining similar weightings.  The Nasdaq-100 is weighted by market capitalization, meaning its largest constituents have a greater influence over its performance than the smallest.

Nvidia rose to become one of best AI stocks (if not the best) because it sells graphics processing units (GPUs) and the infrastructure to support them.

headline: Investing $15,000 Into Each of These 3 Growth Stocks 10 Years Ago Would Have Generated Over $3.8 Million in Profit Today
summary: Regardless of how much money you have available to invest in the stock market, it can be a good idea to spread it across multiple stocks.  It can be difficult to predict which stocks will be winners in the long run, so investing in several promising growth stocks is a way to increase the odds that you achieve significant returns.  Three stocks that have generated better than 10x returns over the past 10 years are Nvidia (NASDAQ: NVDA), Axon Enterprise (NASDAQ: AXON), and Builders FirstSource (NYSE: BLDR).
